Moreover, those birds have various forms and appearances, which people love to see. They have various thoughts and enjoy various pleasures.
What are those pleasures?
Some hold lotus flowers in their beaks, listen to singing with their ears, and walk around. The males and females follow each other and play.
Some birds stay in groups, stretch out their bodies, and listen to the sounds from the tree branches and houses with single-minded attention.
Some hold bright and luminous jewels in their beaks and roam everywhere.

Some have bodies of the seven treasures. Because they hear singing from the mountains, they flap their wings and fly over to listen to the singing. They go to the houses of flower branches, and the entire sky is adorned and beautiful. They are joyful in their hearts.
There are other birds in other forests, adorned with various wonderful jewels on their wings, who use their beaks to pick various blooming flowers, bring them to the flower-branch houses.
Having heard the singing sounds of other birds, they bring jeweled garlands together, with various colors and wonderful light.
Coming in this way to the flower-branch houses, pervading the sky, all of them are wonderfully adorned, coming in this way.
In this way, the birds and beasts in that forest have various colors, various forms, and various perfections, all of them are delightful.
That forest is extremely wonderful and beautiful, in this way the heavenly multitudes in that forest experience various pleasures.
At that time, the five sounds of music in that forest, they play for a long time, burned by the fire of desire, still not content, they go to another forest.

The forest is called Bird Sounds and Pleasures, and the countless celestial maidens surround themselves there, singing, dancing, delighting, laughing, playing, and plucking the qin in the sky, flying like this.

Some go this way riding on geese, and other gods ride peacocks, some sit on lotus pedestals in the sky and go this way, and still other gods ride seven-jeweled birds in the sky and go this way, all heading for the Bird Sounds and Pleasures Forest.
They travel like this, not yet having arrived, fully endowed with various supreme pleasures, wishing to reach that forest.
The birds called Truth-Telling Birds spoke a verse, saying:
Among vehicles, the vehicle of karma is supreme, the other vehicles are not so.
Because humans ride the vehicle of karma, they can travel through the three realms.
Who, where, what karma, how to make it,
They will then in that place, according to what they do, experience suffering and happiness.
The various mixed karmas are created by the causes and conditions of the mind.
There is nothing that cannot be obtained, as long as one perseveres.
The various different kinds of happiness arise from the causes and conditions of karma.
Because the causes of karma are exhausted, the various kinds of happiness also disappear.
If one does not lose what one has, and does good deeds from the past,
If one always wishes to obtain happiness, one should create other karma.
If the mind is always lazy and intoxicated by the poison of indulgence,
The careless gods do not realize the place of future suffering and distress.
All happiness is separated, and one arrives at a place of great suffering and distress,
Because it can destroy the aggregates and realms, it is called death.
It will quickly come and cause the end of life,
Because one is deluded by the realms of the heavens, one does not realize it.
The truthful birds, out of a good mind and compassion for the heavenly multitudes, spoke these verses of true Dharma in this way, benefiting the gods.
But the gods did not accept it, because their minds were covered by desire. They became even more joyful and went further into the forest of the sounds of birds.
The minds of all the heavenly multitudes were delighted to see the forest of the sounds of birds. The name of this forest was like this, and there were also such sounds of birds.
In that forest, all the trees were made of jewels, namely gold, silver, and vaiá¸Å«rya trees, some were made of white silver, some were made of crystal, and some were made of blue jewels.
In that flat pond, there was a forest of lotus flowers. Those lotus flowers were like lamp trees, all kinds of colors, extremely delightful.
There were various kinds of birds with innumerable colors and shapes, their wings interspersed with jewels, indescribable in detail.
Why is it so?
Because of the immeasurable types of wholesome actions of the mind, the forms of the birds are also of various types.
Because the mind is mixed, mixed wholesome actions are created. Because of the mixture of wholesome actions, such fruits are obtained, which cannot be fully described.
Because the mind is subtle and rapidly flowing, for this reason it cannot be fully described. All heavenly phenomena are indescribable.

The heavenly karmic fruits are now being partially explained. There are delightful sensual objects, carelessness, gardens, forests, flowing waters, lotus ponds, various mountain peaks, lotus groves, birds, jewels, and lovely heavenly maidens.
Because of karmic fruits, such transformations appear in the heavenly realms.
This cause and effect is said to be delightful for the heavens, just as the fruits created by good karma are not lost or destroyed;
If not created, the fruits cannot be obtained.
Moreover, for this reason, it is said to be blissful.
Moreover, the gods' bodies are adorned with various garlands, their bodies are anointed with fragrances, and their own light brings them happiness and joy.
Thus observing the pleasure grove of the birds' voices, they see the flames of the light of the various jeweled trees, surrounded by various birds.
The birds sing, and when the gods hear it, they hear sounds they have never heard before, and upon hearing them, their minds are delighted and they experience pleasure.
All the gods hear it and are happy.

translated: Some of the birds live in the trees and sing, some of the birds sing in the lotus groves, some sing in the flowers, and some birds sing in the lotus ponds.
The gods hear it and their minds are delighted and happy.
If the gods and goddesses gather together, all the various singing stops, and they listen to the birds' singing, their minds filled with love and joy.

In this way, the singing of those birds pervades the mountain peaks. All the animals on the mountain peaks, by their own nature delighting in singing, when they hear that singing, whether a hundred or a thousand of them, all come near.
Having come near, their ears are unmoving, listening to the singing.
Some stay at the foot of the trees listening to the singing, some face the heavenly grass, wanting to eat without a thought, listening to the singing.
In that forest, the sound of the birds' singing is so delightful, the forest of the birds' delightful singing is so lovely.

Moreover, in that forest, the fragrance is so delightful, the fragrance of various flowers, having various colors, all exist according to thought, fragrance, color, sound, etc. are all obtained according to thought.

The various beautiful sounds such as the lute, drum, zither, flute, and singing, the heavenly sounds, the sound of those birds surpasses those heavenly sounds, because of being superior in one sense-object. In this way, that forest is lovely.
Moreover, in that forest, there is another delightful sense object called 'heavenly flavor.'
According to one's thoughts, one obtains the superior fruit flavor or the flavor of heavenly wine and heavenly medicinal herbs.
In this way, in that forest, one obtains the flavor according to one's thoughts. In this way, in that forest, all flavors are complete.
Moreover, in that forest, there is another superior dharma, namely, a mountain.
Playing on that mountain, the branches and nets cover everywhere. The various multi-storied buildings are all made of branches and nets, and one moves without confusion.

There are countless kinds of walls made of the seven treasures, and countless kinds of colorful paintings are everywhere. Many kinds of beautifully adorned heavenly maidens are in the multi-storied buildings.
That forest is adorned in this way with various things.
Moreover, that garden forest has another kind of adornment.
The merits of that forest have been fully explained.

Now, I will further explain the characteristics of the adorableness and completeness of the mountain adornments. It is said that the mountain is adorned with lapis lazuli, and the mountain is endowed with seven kinds of merits.
What are the seven?
Namely, form, sound, touch, taste, and smell, all obtained as one wishes. There are wish-fulfilling trees, complete with seven kinds.
The gods there, seeing those merits, deluded by confusion, do not see or hear the birds speaking the Dharma.
The birds that speak the Dharma, like parents, speak the Dharma that is all certain.
The gods, attached to objects, do not hear or perceive. Deluded by objects, they do not accept the birds' words, and wander in the wilderness of desire.
Again, heading to the great forest, burned by the three fires, controlled by the five enemies, deceived by the love of joy, confused about the true path, having only suffering and pleasure.

Pleasure similar to suffering. Attached to such false pleasure, they do not perceive or know, do not accept or take the beneficial Dharma that is spoken, but listen to the singing of the birds of the three places that they go to.

The water-dwelling birds are loved by the gods, with beautiful forms and bodies of the seven treasures, mixed with various colors, such as geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks. The sounds of these birds and the sounds of the water are like the beautiful and wonderful sounds of singing that the gods love to hear. They always enjoy themselves and indulge in pleasures.
All the gods love those sounds. In this way, the gods hear the various sounds of other birds, but not the sound of the Dharma.

The birds that live in the forests have various sounds, such as peacocks, white doves, birds that adorn the trees, and birds that live in the mountains, valleys, and caves. They emit beautiful and wonderful sounds, all similar to the sounds of various birds. The birds with bodies of the seven treasures adorn the mountains, flying in pairs in the sky, emitting sounds together.
Observing those birds is like seeing adornments. The light of those birds is always delightful to see, giving rise to a mind of attachment. In this way, the sounds of the various birds are superior.

The gods who enjoy hearing voices, singing, and echoes, in this way hear the various sounds of the bÄkula birds in countless ways, and with their lustful minds surrounded by the celestial maidens, they listen to those sounds and enjoy hearing them for a long time. Even more, love covers their minds.
They also drink celestial wine, which has the best flavor and fragrance. It flows out from the caves as it should, and many wonderful bees gather on the wine.
Those gods drink the celestial wine with each other in harmony, without obstructing each other.
Moreover, other gods go to the lotus grove, where there is celestial wine in the lotus petals. It has the best celestial flavor and fragrance, and the flavor arises as one thinks of it.
The gods and goddesses drink it to their heart's content, singing, dancing, playing, and laughing, with each other in harmony, sharing the same lustful thoughts.
Those gods, in the excellent forest, play and enjoy themselves, their minds not satiated with objects, and again go to the mountain adorned with lapis lazuli.
That mountain has many geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks, all with blue shadows, covering a myriad of yojanas, all of them blue shadows.
The mountain is three hundred yojanas high, has many gardens and forests, is full of lotus ponds and flowing water, and has the most beautiful birds, all of which are loved by those who see them.
On that mountain there are good flatlands, good mountain valleys, good rocky caves, river springs and caves, many walking forests, lotus ponds, and all kinds of flowers.

There are three kinds of geese that emerge from the shore and sing, namely geese with the color of crystal, interspersed with the seven treasures, or with a white body. Such geese are very abundant in the mountains and adorn the mountain.
The lapis lazuli mountain is everywhere full of flowing water, the color of the water is pure like a precious pearl.
The mountain is full of various fragrant flowers, and there are countless hundreds of thousands of various birds, adorning the lotus ponds with these various birds.

These various superior and superior rare things, the most lovely colors adorn the mountain, and the mountain is adorned with countless sounds, textures, fragrances, and other things, with the six sense faculties experiencing pleasure everywhere on the mountain.

The heavenly beings, wishing to experience pleasure, go to that mountain, singing and dancing everywhere, with lotus garlands and necklaces adorning their bodies, always enjoying themselves, their minds always joyful and delighted.
The enemy of the five sense objects burns them with the five fires, and the bonds of desire strangle their throats.
They go up the mountain peak in order to experience pleasure, hoping to see various things, remembering various things, and discriminating various things.
As they gradually approach, they see a mountain cave made of lapis lazuli.
The mountain cave has a blue light, with ten thousand adornments, and a supreme and wonderful light of universal bliss.
If the gods dwelling on the mountain enter the cave, they will play in various ways.
If the gods enter the cave, the cave will become wider and wider, just as the gods' minds are, and just as their various thoughts are, they will be able to obtain everything in the cave.
The cave is called the Cave of Obtaining as One Thinks. The gods dwelling in the cave always enjoy pleasures with the celestial maidens, never knowing enough.

The celestial maidens are adorned in various ways. Due to their good karma, they see the celestial maidens and their minds are extremely delighted. Their appearance and adornments are exceptionally beautiful. They sing, dance, laugh, and experience celestial pleasures.
The king of the YÄma Heaven, SuyÄma, in order to benefit the gods, wrote the verses spoken by the Buddha on the door of the jeweled cave on the mountain. The verses are as follows:
The king of death devours sentient beings, old age drinks the young,
When sickness arrives, it destroys the strong and healthy, the world is ignorant of this.
There are innumerable kinds of birth, there are innumerable kinds of decline,
Just as there is birth and old age, the world is ignorant of this.
There is not a single moment, not a single time or day,
Death has no time or place to stay, the world is ignorant of this.
Having already been born again and again, having also declined again and again,
The deluded gods are confused by objects, the world is ignorant of this.
This wheel of existence is like a cage, attached to desires and pleasures,
Bound by the rope of love, they are led away, the world is ignorant of this.
In the waves of the faults of love, there are many discriminating birds,
This river of love is vast, the world is ignorant of this.ğŸ”½Here ends the chapter on the five aggregates, the sixth chapter in the RatnakÅ«á¹­a-sÅ«tra.
The gate of that treasure cave is for the benefit of the gods. It is written with the Buddha's verses. The Dharma is like this.
If a god sees it, he will then read it. After reading the verses, he will remember his past life and for a short time he will not engage in negligence.
Because of good karma, in a short time with right thought, he increases immeasurable hundreds of thousands of joys for many future lives. He increases the pure part and diminishes the defiled part.
In this way, the gods' brief right mindfulness can destroy the number of lives accumulated over hundreds of thousands of eons.
If there are those who see the verses written above the gate of the treasure cave, they will give rise to disgust and engage in non-negligent conduct;
if the gods enter the cave but do not read the verses, then their entry is in vain.
Whether one sees or does not see all that enters, one engages in negligent conduct.
Inside, in one place, one sees a gathering of precious jewels, namely a gathering of vajras, a gathering of blue jewels, a gathering of makaradhvaja jewels, and a gathering of great blue jewels.
The nature of that jeweled cave is self-luminous, and because of the precious jewels, the light is even more radiant.
Third, because the gods enter it, the light of the gods' bodies causes the light of that jeweled cave to become even more radiant, and thus that cave is extremely delightful.
In that jeweled cave, the gods and goddesses enjoy the five desires and pleasures, peacefully and happily, free from distress.
Free from heat and distress, far from sorrow and grief, due to their own good karma, they experience immeasurable kinds of supreme heavenly bliss.
Having seen that jeweled ground, the gods give rise to a joyful mind, singing, dancing, and playing, enjoying themselves with the sounds of the five musical instruments.
Moreover, those who enter that jeweled cave will see a river filled with the most fragrant and delightful heavenly wine.
On both banks of that wine river, there are drinking birds that serve as adornments.

These birds are called joyful, always happy, always playful, without different tastes, seeing what is lovable, and carefully observing the mind. There are birds called not enjoying other places, and drinking fragrant happiness. These are the various birds.
There are also other birds that play and drink wine in that wine river.
Because of the good karma of the gods, the birds spoke a verse, saying:
First drinking delicious wine, after drinking, doing much evil,
In the future, obtaining evil fruits, in the hells.
After drinking, able to make one deluded, because of delusion, creating evil karma,
Because of creating evil karma out of delusion, entering the hells.
First, giving rise to joy, later, obtaining evil retribution,
First, able to quench thirst, later, becoming very hot.
First, losing speech and mind, later, losing happiness,
Therefore, the wise should not drink alcohol.
If one always drinks alcohol, one is no different from a bird.
Drinking alcohol can cause delusion, so alcohol is called a great poison.
If one sees alcohol as poison, one sees the place of non-retrogression.
If one drinks alcohol without tasting it, it is like drinking molten iron.
One part of all evils is said to be one part of alcohol.
This is the mind's transgression, the root of all precepts and the mind.
Drinking alcohol makes the mind incorrect and unable to contemplate the Dharma.
Because bhiká¹£us drink alcohol, they do not practice in the wilderness.
Drinking alcohol makes the mind confused, undisciplined, and shameless.
One loses the Dharma, becomes empty and without blessings, and loses the present and future.
Not knowing how to cultivate deportment, not knowing time and place,
Obstructing the true Dharma, only speaking without meaning.
If one cannot know oneself, how can one know what to say?
One's own words are like excrement, and one cannot know oneself.
It causes the world to despise, and causes the Dharma not to flourish.
Seeing the poor drinking alcohol is like a blazing fire.
Past events are all forgotten, and present events are all confused.
How much more so to contemplate the future, drinking alcohol loses in three periods of time.
It can destroy name and form, or lose the body of sentient beings.
It can give rise to immeasurable faults, drinking alcohol obstructs the Dharma.'
'In this way, the bird living in the mountain cave always delights in its mind. For the sake of the devas, it speaks these verses due to the causes and conditions of its karma.
If the devas who have heard this have good karma and are born there in accordance with the Dharma, they will remember their previous lives;
Because they remember their previous lives, they will know the faults of alcohol;
Because they know the faults of alcohol, they will not drink alcohol and will not engage in careless conduct.'

The other gods who did not accept the bird's verse still drank alcohol, gave rise to a joyful mind, and enjoyed themselves with the sounds of the five types of music, singing and dancing, and so forth, for a long time in the mountain cave, experiencing various pleasures.
After enjoying themselves, they emerged from the way they had entered.
Having emerged in this way, they still did not know contentment with regard to objects and continued to act with heedlessness.
They enjoyed seeing the gardens and forests, and together with the celestial maidens they again engaged in various amusements in the rivers, mountains, and valleys of all the gardens and forests.
In this way, the gods, due to their good karma, experience such pleasures.
That place is like this, beyond comparison, with heavenly pleasures complete.
Those gods experience the pleasures of the five senses and do not know contentment, due to their vast and abundant desires.
What is meant by 'vast'? Because their bodies are vast, they are never restrained, but are always open and expansive, and therefore called 'vast'.
They are also insatiable in their enjoyment of objects, because objects are vast and limitless, and their faculties are always thirsting, never satisfied.

Thus, the five sense pleasures of those gods increase and grow, without end, and they constantly experience sensual pleasures. Their minds give rise to a sense of wonder, and their delightful qualities are beyond comparison.
Therefore, those gods are insatiable, just as the ocean never has enough and swallows up rivers, the gods' lack of satisfaction is also like this.
They always experience such pleasures in that heavenly realm, roaming through various gardens and forests, carried away by the waters of desire, playing and enjoying themselves with the goddesses.

Those gods will continue in this way until their accumulated good karma from loving actions is exhausted. Later, when they fall from that heavenly realm, they will be bound by the rope of their own actions, as their actions dictate.
Having fallen from that realm of pleasure when their karma is exhausted, they will fall into the hells, the realm of hungry ghosts, or the realm of animals.

If there are other gods who, due to other wholesome karma, are reborn among humans, in JambudvÄ«pa, in a place of great wealth and happiness, in the foremost caste, singing, dancing, laughing, and playing various games, always experiencing happiness, with a body of extraordinary beauty, a dignified appearance, and various perfections, in a superior country;
either as a king or a minister, in the countries of KÄÅ›i or KoÅ›ala, in the continent of security.
This is due to their remaining karma.
The ninth ground of the excellent light garden place of the Heaven of YÄma is concluded.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the consequences of karma, observes the grounds of the Heaven of YÄma.
He sees, hears of, or knows with the divine eye:
There is another place called Right Practice.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He sees:

There are people who follow the Dharma, practice correctly, are supremely pure, and have pure rewards. Because their karma is pure, they experience the rewards of happiness, which are loved by the sages.
They excel in generosity but are lacking in wisdom.
Because of their generosity, they are reborn among the gods and experience the fruits of divine love.
What is meant by the heavenly realm? What kind of person attains the heavenly rewards?
It means that someone with a pure and wholesome mind, who gives rise to a respectful and gentle mind, who does not kill or steal as explained before,

and who further abandons sexual misconduct, namely, upon hearing that someone in the past had engaged in sexual activity with a woman, having heard this, they do not delight in it, do not think about past desires, do not give rise to thoughts, and are able to stop others from thinking about it.

Having accomplished such pure karmic actions, upon the collapse of the body and the end of life, they are reborn in the good destinies, in the heaven of YÄma, in the place of right conduct, experiencing the fruits of the wholesome karma they cultivated in the past.
Having been born there, they delight in the immeasurable sense objects of various smells, tastes, and textures, and roam in the gardens and forests.
In the heavenly lotus ponds, they are served by hundreds of thousands of heavenly maidens.
They roam in the gardens, forests, lotus ponds, and flowing waters, never staying still for a moment.
The various heavenly pleasures they experience, which have never been seen before and cannot be compared to or fully described, are immeasurable.
Their minds are never satisfied with the objects of their senses.
Moreover, in that place there are innumerable kinds of heavenly wonderful gardens and forests. In this way, the newly born heavenly being is surrounded by a group of young women.

In other gardens and forests, groups of heavenly maidens are playing. When they see the newly born heavenly being, their minds become aroused, and their manner is different from before. Adorned with heavenly garments, garlands, and various ornaments, they approach the newly born heavenly being.
When the newly born heavenly being sees the heavenly maidens, his desire becomes five times stronger, and he immediately goes to be near them.
The celestial maidens and newly born gods mix and unite with each other, experiencing countless kinds of pleasures together, with the same mind and intention, not opposing each other.
In this way, the celestial maidens all sing together, joyfully dancing and laughing. The newly born gods have this thought:
'This newly born god is my husband.'
The newly born god has this thought:
'These celestial maidens are my wives.'
In this way, the gods and goddesses trust each other, without any suspicion, joyfully laughing, singing and dancing, loving each other.

In the gardens and forests, they go from one garden and forest to another, from one mountain peak to another, from one lotus pond to another, from one tree house to another, from one grove to another, from one pond to another.
Such ponds are the color of sapphires.
In the pond there are geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks with various sounds. There are such innumerable birds with various sounds, which are delightful to the ears and the mind, just as one wishes.
Thus, the water has complete color, fragrance, and flavor.
In the pond there are innumerable kinds of singing, dancing, and games, experiencing all kinds of pleasures.

Having experienced pleasure, they again see other groups of gods joyfully roaming about. The newly born god sees this and immediately goes there with the group of goddesses, with the sounds of the five types of music, singing, dancing, and playing like this as they go.
At that time, the gods, having seen this newly born god, spoke a verse, saying:
In the mountains, gardens, forests, and so forth, or in the lotus ponds,
In all the multi-storied buildings, together with the goddesses, experiencing pleasure.
Or in the golden mountains, or on the peaks of lapis lazuli,
Or in the gardens, forests, and groves, together with the goddesses, experiencing pleasure.
Following one's thoughts, one finds delightful trees, or in flowing streams and rivers,
Or in vast ponds, together with celestial maidens one experiences bliss.
In places interspersed with the seven treasures, or in mountains and rivers,
Or in level and excellent locations, together with celestial maidens one experiences bliss.
In forests of mandÄra trees, and in forests of blue utpala flowers,
In places with the sounds of various birds, together with celestial maidens one experiences bliss.
In various regions, or in forests of jewels,
Or in delightful halls, together with celestial maidens one experiences bliss.
Or with the sounds of the five types of music, causing the mind to be joyfully cool,
Always singing, dancing, and playing, together with celestial maidens one experiences bliss.'

The celestial beings thus speak verses for the newly born celestial being. When the newly born celestial son hears the verses, there are also real-word birds there, who speak verses for the sake of benefiting in accordance with the Dharma and causing correct practice:
In mountain gardens and forests, or in lotus groves,
Deluded by craving, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
Or in golden mountains, or on lapis lazuli peaks,
When the food of good karma is exhausted, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
Following thoughts of desirable trees, or in rivers with flowing water,
When the good karma of play is exhausted, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
In places interspersed with the seven treasures, or in mountains and rivers,
Deluded by objects, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
In groves of mandÄra trees, or in groves of blue utpala flowers,
Blind with attachment to pleasure, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
In various parts of the ground, or in jeweled forests,
Not practicing good dharmas, together with celestial maidens, one falls.
Or with the sounds of the five kinds of music, causing the mind to joyfully cool,
Because of attachment, time passes, and they fall together with the celestial maidens.

' The birds of truthful speech, for the benefit of the devas, in accordance with what is beneficial, causing the devas to be at ease, in order to make them practice correctly, speak these verses in this way.
Although the devas are heedless and do not listen, the old devas still do not accept it, let alone the newly born devas.

The old and new devas, because they are injured by the poison of heedlessness, all sing and dance, their minds filled with joy. In the gardens and forests, they play everywhere, experiencing the pleasures of the objects of the senses.
Their own bodies are radiant, not needing any other illumination.
All the devas, together with the celestial maidens, again go to a mountain called Mountain Garland.

On that Mountain Garland, there are many kinds of precious substances, adorned with various jewels, with the light of all the mountains, hundreds of thousands of lotuses, adorned like the sun just rising, with hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of flowing springs and ponds.
On the four sides of the mountain there are four groves, namely, the first is called Hundred Ponds Flowing Water;
the second is called Great Light;
the third is called Adorned Mountain;
the fourth is called Universal Fragrance.
These are called the four groves, located on the sides of that mountain.

In the midst of the Hundred Ponds Flowing Water grove on one side of the mountain, there is a wish-fulfilling tree, with hundreds of thousands of ponds, golden, silver, and green jeweled fish, universally filling the ponds.
The water in the ponds is pure, cool, and refreshing, filling the ponds according to one's wishes.
There are many gardens and forests surrounding the ponds, with the lovely sounds of geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks, delightful to the hearer.
There is a bird called Always Joyful, who, seeing the heavenly multitudes, spoke a verse, saying:
All life is impermanent, youth does not stay,
This heavenly realm is also like this, yet the gods do not realize it.
All phenomena are impermanent, and in succession they all perish and decay.
Bound by the ropes of karma, the world does not realize this.
The many billions of heavenly beings, roaming in the gardens and forests,
When the time of decline is about to arrive, the world does not realize this.
The gods of the six desire heavens, carelessly enjoying pleasures,
All will be lost and destroyed, the world does not realize this.
Pleasure is like a mass of water bubbles, like objects obtained in a dream,
Quickly disappearing, not remaining for long, the world does not realize this.
' When the gods there are about to ascend the mountain, the always joyful birds always speak these verses with a beneficial mind and because of the good karma of the gods.
However, because the gods enjoy objects, they do not listen, do not accept, do not realize, do not know, cannot see the truth, and do not look at the birds.
It is like the born-blind who do not see the path.
At that time, the gods next went to the second great light grove, the light of which surpassed the light of a hundred suns.
